column4: Anyone help? I've shrunk my windows partition, I'd now like to increase the size of my ubuntu partition, so I booted from the live disc and ran gparted - this is the window I get - http://bluesuncorp.co.uk/files/screenshot-dev-sda-gparted.jpg - but for some reason it won't let me extend sda5 into the free space on the left
you can extend a file system (sometimes) by adding to the END of it, not the beginning
I should be able to move it though, right? and gparted won't let me do that
ugly hack? create another partition, cpio from one to the other, reboot, delete the one at the end, then extend it
